result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tasir Qaiser Bhatti

records.addlTxt:
Per email with defense counsel Plea and Sentence rescheduled from 11-23-2022 to December 1, 2022 at 9:30am.
State notified.

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Tasir Qaiser Bhatti. 
 Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a resolution date. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
 Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, in custody.  
Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini supervised by Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request an additional status date.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti in court with Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer D. Langfelt.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Cse set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. Defense moved to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti in court, with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz. Tasir Bhatti is in custody. John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was mistakenly set for Status. A preliminary hearing needs to be held. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Counsel, signed and scanned into case.  mn

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court appointed Attorney Douglas Rebholz as counsel of record to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Recoupment is held open.  Case is adjourned in br 45 for scheduling.   mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court via zoom, defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Hearing. Defendant not produced. Attorney Thomas Reed appeared on behalf of the State Public Defender's Office. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court and requests additional time to appoint counsel. Court grants request. Case remains calendared as previously set.

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Matter to be heard in Br. 16 for Br. 45.  Hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  States witness is present.  SPD has not been appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 8:30

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Tasir Qaiser Bhatti in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
